content:
Here are some strength training exercises you can do on Tuesday (Core and Legs) and Thursday (Arms and Shoulders) at the gym:

**Tuesday (Core and Legs)**

1. Warm-up: 5-10 minutes on the treadmill or stationary bike
2. Squats: 3 sets of 8-12 reps
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, then bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
3. Leg Press: 3 sets of 10-15 reps
	* Sit at a leg press machine and push the platform away from you with your feet.
4. Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps (per leg)
	* Stand with your feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower your body until your back knee almost touches the ground. Alternate legs.
5. Leg Extensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Sit at a leg extension machine and lift the weight up with your legs.
6. Leg Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps
	* Sit at a leg curl machine and lift the weight up with your legs.
7. Plank: 3 sets of 30-60 seconds
	* Start in a push-up position, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
8. Russian twists: 3 sets of 10-12 reps
	* Sit on a mat with your knees bent and feet flat, lean back slightly, and twist your torso to left and right, touching your hands to the ground each time.
9. Cool-down: 5-10 minutes of stretching

**Thursday (Arms and Shoulders)**

1. Warm-up: 5-10 minutes on the treadmill or stationary bike
2. Bicep Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold dumbbells with your palms facing forward, and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders.
3. Tricep Dips: 3 sets of 10-12 reps
	* Sit at a tricep dip machine and lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are bent at a 90-degree angle.
4. Shoulder Press: 3 sets of 8-12 reps
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold dumbbells at shoulder height with your palms facing forward, and press the dumbbells straight up over your head.
5. Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 10-12 reps
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold dumbbells at shoulder height with your palms facing your thighs, and lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they're at shoulder height.
6. Rear Delt Fly: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold dumbbells with your arms bent and palms facing your thighs, and lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they're at shoulder height.
7. Cool-down: 5-10 minutes of stretching

Remember to:

* Start with a weight that allows you to complete the given number of reps with good form.
* Increase the weight as you get stronger.
* Rest for 60-90 seconds between sets.
* Focus on proper form and technique throughout each exercise.

Feel free to adjust the exercises or weights based on your personal preferences and fitness level. It's also a good idea to consult with a personal trainer or fitness professional if you're new to strength training or have any concerns.
